channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can Equal Weight Solve Our Concentration Crisis? Not So Fast…
item.description: Mega-cap concentration has exploded since 2015. The corollary to an increasingly top-heavy benchmark is that market diversification and breadth have never been more limited. A multifactor methodology can be a restorative balance to US equities when more traditional measures fall short.

item.title: Tesla is looking to hire 800 new employees 3 months after Elon Musk ordered mass firings of thousands
item.description: The roles have steadily popped up on Tesla’s careers page in recent weeks, with positions spanning artificial intelligence specialists to more run-of-the-mill service jobs.

item.title: In Search of the Elusive Neutral Interest Rate
item.description: With Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's semiannual address to the Senate Banking Committee this week fresh in mind, it is an ideal time to consider the drivers of r*.

item.title: Dublin residents are standing up to $2.3 trillion neighbor Google’s plans to build a pub, saying they are ‘effectively living’ on the tech giant’s campus
item.description: Locals living next to Google's Dublin campus say they will be subjected to public urination if the tech giant is allowed to build a pub.

item.title: Commodities for the Long Run?
item.description: Asset classes such as commodities have historically had notable diversification benefits for longer-term investors who are concerned with inflation.

item.title: Uber is betting millions on a startup hoping to solve the biggest roadblock facing electric vehicles
item.description: The ride-share giant is helping fund a startup to make EV charging as easy for renters as for homeowners

item.title: Vanguard’s Former OCIO Clients Must Stand Their Ground
item.description: Vanguard's OCIO clients should be wary of the higher-fee active funds and alternative investments that are now open to them.

item.title: Trump’s new VP pick JD Vance brands China the ‘biggest threat’ to the U.S.: ‘We are completely distracted from it’
item.description: JD Vance called China the "biggest threat" in an interview with Fox News shortly after his nomination.

item.title: Are Your Data Governance and Management Practices Keeping Pace with the AI Boom?
item.description: No matter how sophisticated and expensive a firm's AI tools are, it should not forget that the principle “garbage in, garbage out” (GIGO) applies to the entire investment management process.

item.title: Nokia CEO: Europe shouldn’t be afraid to back its innovation champions
item.description: While Europe is still home to world-leading companies, the European Union has fallen behind both the U.S. and China in key technologies.
